subject: Philosophy
title: Choosing Without Guarantees
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Choosing Without Guarantees.

hook.text: You can't know if your career choice is right until years later. But you have to choose now.

buildup.text: Existentialism says there are no guarantees. No decision comes with a promise of success.

discovery.text: Kierkegaard called this the 'leap.' You commit fully knowing you might be wrong.

twist.text: Waiting for certainty is itself a choice â€” and usually a bad one. Life doesn't pause while you decide.

climax.text: The existentialist acts despite uncertainty. That's not recklessness â€” it's courage.

punchline.text: Certainty is a myth. Commitment is real.

quiz.question: What did Kierkegaard mean by 'the leap'?
